intro: Haemocharis anceps, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a tropical flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescence. The plant features bright yellow spathes that enclose a central, colorful spadix, creating a dramatic visual display. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Haemocharis anceps is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant and long-lasting blooms.
